alert.note: Alert for Bonner; Boundary (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued December 28 at 7:22AM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: The Idaho Panhandle Avalanche Center in Sandpoint has continued a BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WARNING for the following areas: Bonner and Boundary Counties * WHAT...The avalanche danger for the warning area will rise to high today. * WHERE...Selkirk and Cabinet Mountains of Idaho Panhandle and the Cabinet and Purcell Ranges of Northwest Montana. * WHEN...In effect through Thu 07:00 PST. * IMPACTS...Recent rain and heavy snowfall combined with wind will likely create widespread areas of unstable snow Wednesday. * PRECAUTIONARY / PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...Very dangerous avalanche conditions. Travel in avalanche terrain is not recommended. Avalanches may run long distances and can run into mature forests, valley floors, or flat terrain. Consult http://www.idahopanhandleavalanche.org/ or www.avalanche.org for more detailed information. Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of this or any avalanche center.
